results.title: Shapes of progress
results.creator_credit: John Mallison, Margaret K Johns and Liberatas Films
results.brief_description: Modern industrial design in Britain. A number if different designers comment on their own work, and explain their individual approach to design. Illustrates how everything that is made has first to be designed, and how the work of designers in the modern world effects everyone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Mallison, Margaret K Johns and Liberatas Films

results.title: Shaped By Danish hands
results.creator_credit: Hagen Hasselbalch, Minerva Film and Government Film Committee of Denmark
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of Danish craftsmen in the making of pottery, furniture, toys, silverware, etc. Begins by showing ceramic workers making pottery and earthenware and then describes some of the experiments in design and in the use if new types of glazes by various artists. Examples of ceramic ware of the foremost artists in Denmark are shown. Prominent furniture designers are then shown at work and examples of designs of modern furniture, including types suitable for mass production are illustrated. Designs for wooden toys are shown too. Concludes by showing how artists plan new designs in silver and how silversmiths fashion articles from their designs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hagen Hasselbalch, Minerva Film and Government Film Committee of Denmark

results.title: Shantiniketan: Abode of Peace
results.creator_credit: K Samarth, A P Sinha, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: In 1901, there was established at Shantiniketan an institution for boys and girls, where education was in close communion with nature. Twenty years later, the institution had grown to such proportions that it came to be recognised as an international university, the Visva-Bharati. This film gives an interesting glimpse of Shantiniketan the “Abode of peace”, the school of international culture, established by the Poet Rabindranath Tagore at Bolpur, not far from Calcutta. Languages, sculpture, painting, embroidery, music, dancing and other fine arts are an integral part of training.

results.brief_description: Shanghai, the largest city in Red Chna: a culture in transition. Gives an inside look at a city’s people and their government.

results.title: Shanghai triad
results.creator_credit: Zhang Yimou, Jean-Louis Piel, Wu Yigong and Shanghai Film Studio
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s, this film centres on the coming of age of Shuisheng, a country boy brought to Shanghai by his uncle to work for the powerful gang ruled by Tang. He finds himself working for Bijou, Tang’s capricious mistress and nightclub singer. When Shuisheng’s uncle and several other gang members are killed during a rival gang’s unsuccessful attempt on Tang’s life, the latter escapes to a remote island taking both Bijou and Shuisheng with him and thinking of revenge. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Cast includes: Gong Li, Li Baotian, Li Xuejian, Sun Chun and Wang Xiaoxiao.

results.title: Shanghai noon
results.creator_credit: Tom Dey, Jonathan Glickman, Roger Birnbaum, Gary Barber, Touchstone Pictures, Spyglass Entertainment and Jackie Chan Films
results.brief_description: A case of East meets West in this comic adventure Jackie Chan film set in 1850s American West. Chon Wang (Jackie Chan), an Imperial Guard, is sent across to America as part of a rescue team to find the Emperor’s kidnapped daughter, Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu). However it is not long before Chon Wang becomes separated from the search party and finds himself lost out in the vast open spaces of the West where he has a timely encounter with a bright but arrogant train robber by the name of Roy O’Bannon (Owen Wilson). The two become unlikely allies. Cast also includes Brandon Merrill, Roger Yuan.

results.title: Shanghai Express
results.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Adolph Zukor and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The lightweight plot - an evacuation by train from Peking to Shanghai - is merely the pretext for one of Sternberg’s most successful pieces of stylization, a fruitful collaboration with cinematographer Lee Garmes (and an uncredited James Wong Howe), and writer Jules Furthman. Dietrich plays Shanghai Lily, a ‘coaster’ (a woman who lives by her wits along the Chinese coast) whose scandalous lifestyle is summed up in the films now classic line, ‘It took more than one man to change my name to Shanghai Lily’. Clive Brook’s plays Dietrich’s love interest Captain Donald Harvey, a stuffy Englishman who knew Lily before her infamous lifestyle and is still hurting from her having previously run off on him. Sternberg uses the stop-start cadences of the narrative as a means to evoke the rhythm of the train, while functioning as a kind of time machine confronting the motley group with their pasts as it carries them to their respective fates. However Sternberg’s main point of interest is Dietrich whose status in the film takes on fetishistic proportions, while being gloriously framed and lit in every scene. Cast includes Anna May Wong, Louise Closser Hale, Eugene Pallette, Lawrence Grant. (Awards: Winner, Best Cinematography- Lee Garmes, Academy Awards, 1932)

results.title: Shane Warne
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Australian Cricket Video
results.brief_description: This is the story of Shane Warne’s mercurial career in his own words. Named one of the five greatest cricketers of the 20th century and Australia’s greatest wicket taker in Test cricket, he commentates on footage of most of the highlights of his career so far, including his Test debut against India in 1991/92, the Test match hat-trick, and the 1999 World Cup victory. He also discusses many amusing behind the scenes tales as well as some of his greatest rivals.

results.title: Shane [Edited version]
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film directed by George Stevens. Starring Alan Ladd as the mysterious stranger who assists a family of homesteaders, highlighting the mythology of the Wild West and the image of the American hero.

results.title: Shane
results.brief_description: George Stevens’ legendary rendition of the archetypal Western myth earned six Academy Award nominations and made “Shane” one of the timeless classics of American cinema. Based on on the novel by Jack Schaefer, a drifter and retired gunfighter (Alan Ladd) comes to the assistance of a homestead family terrorized by an aging cattleman and his hired gun. In fighting the last, decisive battle, Shane sees the end of his way of life. The mysterious, moody and breathtakingly atmospheric cinematography by Loyal Griggs won an Oscar and the film is enhanced by the intense performances of its splendid cast particularly Brandon de Wilde as the young son who idolises Shane.
